channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024090042
item.description:
Report E-2024090042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-11T09:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-03
  • City: DALTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HIGHWAY TRANSPORT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Truck left the facility after being loaded. The washout cap was cross threaded and the material splashed out of the washout for approximately 0.9 miles. The truck pulled over and called in to Highway Transport Chemical (HTC). HTC called Environmental Management, Inc. (EMI). EMI called a local environmental emergency response company, Marion Environmental. Marion personnel spread soda ash on the spill and then pressure washed the material. Storm drains were protected by Marion. The wash water was collected with a vacuum truck.

item.title: Report E-2024090121
item.description:
Report E-2024090121

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-11T09:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-28
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 28, 2024, one (1) box containing six (6) 1-gallon jugs of UN1789 was crushed in transit and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the trailer interior. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged jugs and box were collected in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090076
item.description:
Report E-2024090076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 23, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN1814 were punctured during unloading and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All damaged drums and impacted materials were containerized in four (4) drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090029
item.description:
Report E-2024090029

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 21, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of adhesives was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) quart to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized absorbent pads and cleaners to remediate the impacted site. All impacted materials were collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum, while the damaged pail was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.
